Structured Data.quote: Organized in rows and columns: SQL databases, CSV files, Excel spreadsheets.

Unstructured Data.quote: No predefined format: text documents, images, audio files, social media posts.

Semi-structured Data.quote: Partial organization: JSON, XML, email messages, log files.

Time Series Data.quote: Sequential data points over time: stock prices, weather measurements, sensor readings.

Categorical Data.quote: Discrete categories or labels: gender, color, product types, ratings.

Numerical Data.quote: Quantitative values: age, income, temperature, measurements.

Binary Data.quote: Two possible values: true/false, yes/no, 0/1, success/failure.

Text Corpus.quote: Collection of text documents: articles, books, tweets, reviews.

Image Dataset.quote: Collection of images: photographs, medical images, satellite imagery.

Audio Dataset.quote: Sound recordings: speech, music, environmental sounds.

Video Dataset.quote: Moving images with time: surveillance footage, movie clips, sports recordings.

Graph Data.quote: Nodes and edges: social networks, knowledge graphs, citation networks.

Geospatial Data.quote: Location-based information: GPS coordinates, maps, GIS data.

Panel Data.quote: Multi-dimensional data over time: economic indicators, population studies.

Cross-sectional Data.quote: Observations at single point in time: surveys, census data.

Longitudinal Data.quote: Same sample observed over time: medical studies, growth measurements.

Training Dataset.quote: Data used to train models: labeled examples for supervised learning.

Validation Dataset.quote: Data for model tuning: prevent overfitting, parameter selection.

Test Dataset.quote: Data for final evaluation: assess model performance on unseen data.

Balanced Dataset.quote: Equal representation of classes: uniform distribution of categories.

Imbalanced Dataset.quote: Unequal class distribution: rare events, anomaly detection.

Sparse Dataset.quote: Many missing or zero values: user-item ratings, document-term matrices.

Dense Dataset.quote: Few missing values: complete observations, full matrices.

Streaming Data.quote: Continuous flow of data: IoT sensors, social media feeds, stock tickers.

Batch Data.quote: Processed in groups: daily logs, weekly reports, monthly updates.

Labeled Data.quote: Contains target variables: supervised learning inputs with known outputs.

Unlabeled Data.quote: No target variables: clustering inputs, pattern discovery.

Synthetic Data.quote: Artificially generated: simulations, augmented data, generated samples.

Raw Data.quote: Unprocessed original data: direct measurements, unclean observations.

Cleaned Data.quote: Preprocessed and validated: removed errors, handled missing values.
